Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as the video in question is not related to the COVID-19 lockdown or migrant workers. The video is actually from an army recruitment drive in Faizabad, Uttar Pradesh, which took place in October 2019.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the video depicts migrant workers being stopped at the Delhi-Uttar Pradesh state border during the COVID-19 lockdown in India. However, this assumption is incorrect as the video is unrelated to the lockdown or migrant workers.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the video is not related to the COVID-19 lockdown or migrant workers. The video actually shows an army recruitment drive in Faizabad.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the situation by falsely attributing the video to the COVID-19 lockdown and migrant workers being stopped at the state border.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the video, which is that it shows an army recruitment drive in Faizabad, Uttar Pradesh.
Understate: There is no evidence of any understatement bias in the provided claim.
Falters at times: The claim falters by misinterpreting the video and falsely attributing it to the COVID-19 lockdown and migrant workers being stopped at the state border.
